summary: Experienced registered nurse with over 20 years in clinical nursing, management, statistics, quality management, and process improvement. Proven ability to lead high-performing teams across hospital, clinic, public health, and academic settings. Skilled in coaching, mentoring, facilitation, project management, and curriculum development; strong background in data-driven improvement and performance analytics.

experience.title: Director, Quality Improvement Network Facilitation
experience.description: Manage and analyze state-level data to identify California's performance gaps and opportunities for improvement. Oversee data management, measurement, and reporting to generate reports for senior leadership and boards. Primary liaison for data repositories and advanced analytics (CALNOC, CMQCC, NHSN, HRET, HSAG, UC Davis Population Health). Develop data entry strategies, train hospitals in statistics and analytics, and consult on performance analysis and reporting. Collaborate on CalHEN, Patient Safety First, and Patient & Family engagement. Support grant activities; contribute to research and publications. Led development of public-facing reports and infographics; improved data validation and standardized reporting to stakeholders and media. Managed and mentored 28 hospitals on performance improvement initiatives; demonstrated outcomes improvement and sustainable gains.

experience.title: RN Quality Coordinator
experience.description: Data management, analysis, and reporting; identified performance gaps and developed improvement strategies. Coordinated quality improvement activities, developed data collection processes for inpatient/outpatient coding events, and improved performance and compliance in organ/tissue/donor programs. Led ED referral process improvements and achieved sustained referral increases and regional recognition for best practices.

experience.title: Healthcare Management Chair
experience.company: Des Moines University Osteopathic Medical Center / CHI, Des Moines, IA
experience.description: Managed health administration curricula and teaching activities; developed and evaluated programs, curricula, and resources for healthcare administration. Led instructional design efforts, online course development, and student course integration; oversaw program operations and compliance with accreditation standards.

experience.title: Adjunct Faculty, Assistant Professor
experience.company: Des Moines University Osteopathic Medical Center â€“ College of Health Sciences
experience.description: Plan, coordinate, implement, and evaluate healthcare administration courses. Develop instructional tools and online curricula; expand course offerings and improve student engagement across high-level healthcare administration programs.

experience.title: Clinic Director
experience.description: Managed a healthcare clinic with 25 physicians, NPs, RNs, and support staff; oversaw operations, HR, budgeting, strategic planning, marketing, and regulatory reporting. Led JC accreditation efforts, expanded services (including new dental service), and oversaw renovation and expansion projects.

education.school: Des Moines University Osteopathic Medical Center, College of Health Sciences
Des Moines University Osteopathic Medical Center, College of Health Sciences

certifications: Black Belt Six Sigma - In progress
